law.catch_line: The mental health advisory committee of each county shall consist of:...

section.section: If more than one State inpatient facility serves a county, a representative from at least 1 of the facilities shall be appointed by the Director.
At least one-half of the voting members shall be appointed from among the individuals listed in paragraph (1)(ii)2A through C of this subsection.

Notwithstanding paragraphs (1) through (3) of this subsection, if the governing body of Baltimore City or Anne Arundel County designates a core service agency as the mental health advisory committee, the mental health advisory committee shall consist of the governing body of the core service agency.

text.section: If an intercounty advisory committee is established, the governing body of each participating county shall appoint at least 4 members of the committee.

Notwithstanding subsection (a)(1)(ii) of this section, if the governing body of a county establishes a joint mental health and addictions advisory committee, the governing body may appoint any additional members as necessary to advise and advocate about addictions issues.

section.section: The term of an appointed member is 3 years and begins on July 1.
The terms of one-third of the appointed members of each county advisory committee or intercounty advisory committee end each year.
At the end of a term, a member may continue to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who serves 2 consecutive full 3-year terms may not be reappointed for 2 years after completion of those terms.
